name: Trafford Bank Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large, spacious, beautifully decorated rooms with incredible bathrooms complimented by a very welcoming and helpful host and hostess. I would definitely recommend Trafford Bank to any other couples looking for a first class stay in the Highlands.
reviews.title: Best B&B in Scotland!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Trafford Bank Guest House for one night in July 2008. We had a lovely stay at this sumptuous bed & breakfast, which happens to be among the very best ones one could stay at in Britain. Breakfast on the following was wonderful and beautifully presented. The place is nicely decorated and has the feel of a boutique hotel. We very much recommend this place for anyone visiting Inverness on holiday and looking for quality accommodation in a nice, comfortable, quality setting.
reviews.title: Lovely stay, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a superb place to stay: Lorraine made us feel very comfortable without being at all obtrusive. The house is beautiful with many original features but it is the mix of antiques and contemporary pieces that really makes it so fabulous. We stayed in the Tartan Room - not at all fake Scottish as I feared but very subtly presented. Breakfast was outstanding - though slightly perplexed by the request for orders the night before, this proved to be one of the things that made everything go so smoothly. I think it was the high quality of everything - furnishing and ingredients - that really makes this stand out; it made everything so relaxing. Do go to Chanonry point - we saw dolphins and seals there; the shoreline on the way to Evanton was littered with seals basking on rocks in the sun. Eat at Riva - really enjoyable food. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Outstanding B & B

reviews.text: This is an amazing B & B. We felt completely spoiled for three days - wonderful breakfasts each morning (not just the usual eggs/bacon/sausage), luxurious toiletries (best I've ever seen anywhere), and a really comfortable room. The place was immaculate and deserves the praise it receives! The free use of DVDs and free internet were just icing on the cake.
reviews.title: Perfection

likes.disliked: — A bit off the beaten path - but only short walk to town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the reviews are right, The stay was the best we have had in a B&B.
reviews.title: Sumply superb !

reviews.text: Having been on a short multi hotel/B&B dash round northern Scotland it was with enormous relief when we arrived at Trafford Bank.
reviews.title: A cut above

likes.liked: — roll top bath and sat tv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely one of the best B&BS we've ever stayed in. Fantastically furnished, spacious rooms and tremendously well appointed.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: It will not disappoint.
reviews.title: Best accomodation - Inverness

reviews.text: We normally choose to stay in boutique hotels when we go away and were a liitle concerned that , being "only" a B&B, Trafford Bank might not match up to our expectations. We had no need to worry - it was absolutely superb. We were in Inverness for the first time in many years and stayed for three nights in Trafford Bank. We had the spacious and comfortable Trafford Suite - a fascinating mix of traditional and contemporary features. Breakfast was an occasion all of its own, with a wide and varied selection (including a great choice for vegetarians) and Lorraine's friendly, chatty manner made for a very welcoming atmosphere. And yes - the scones do live up to the hype!
reviews.title: SO comfy

likes.liked: — Comfortable bed, linens, bath, great breakfasts.

reviews.text: State of the art entertainment systems in the room (including access to a massive selection of DVDs), fresh flowers and the exquisite bathroom products all contributed to making this a trip to remember.
reviews.title: We love Trafford Bank!

reviews.text: Dear Lorraine & Koshal
reviews.title: It could not be any better!

likes.disliked: — there was not such a thing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Directly after leaving, we missed Trafford Bank already. These 3 Days were really amazing and there is not a single point to argue about. We enjoyed each second in your house. Lovely decorated rooms with warm special details. Superb cleaning each single day. Friendly help in any matter and great support on our wedding day. THANKS AS WELL FOR THE LOVELY FLOWERS!!!Not to forget the amazing breakfast each morning. (HAGGIS :-) ) Honestly, you asked for critics, but in our mind, there wasn't any. We loved the stay and we try to come back as soon as possible. Thanks a lot for making our visit to Scotland and Inverness such a great one.
reviews.title: Invernes Guest House

reviews.text: Dirk & Karin
reviews.title: Home from Home in Inverness

reviews.text: Very pleasant stay in comfortable houe with good location
reviews.title: More home comforts than home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trafford Bank is the best B&B we have stayed in. We had the Trafford Suite and it was excellent - the decor is first class and the amentities are superb (especially the bath!).
reviews.title: Wow Factor in Inverness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to to stay in a place where style and friendliness go hand in hand, then Trafford Bank is the place for you !
reviews.title: Stylish,Classy & FRIENDLY !

reviews.text: I have read the reviews about this place and I am delighted to say they more than matched our expectations.Right from the start of our break all our needs were catered for, our lovely room was well appointed and spotless.
reviews.title: Lovely Atmosphere

reviews.text: Breakfast (plenty !) was served in the conservatory and the lounges also reflect the owners attention to detail.
reviews.title: Lovely and Gracious B&B

reviews.text: The great British weather tried to dampen our spirits but I'm glad to say our stay at Trafford Bank was a real treat !
reviews.title: The Best B&B Ever !

reviews.text: KP
reviews.title: Trafford Bank - Outstanding

description: Built in 1873 Trafford Bank was the house sof the BIshop of Moray and Rosshire. A Boutique style guest house full of orignal art and local pottery and furniture. 5 ensuite double rooms furnished to the highest standard.
